intro_dialogue: ^You should not have come here… The cold follows those who seek me.
^Are you Mara? The villagers warned me about you.

c-0: ^No one comes here “by accident.” The woods do not allow it.
c-1: ^They fear what they do not understand. One day, you will too.
c-2: ^Mara smiles faintly, as if your silence pleased her.
g-0: ^I can hear them… your sheep. Their wool carries the breath of life.
^But winter is approaching. And winter… takes.

c-3: ^Morana watches us. She demands the old ways be restored.
c-4: ^You already are. Every night you sleep, every time your sheep bleat in the shadows… That is Her whisper.
c-5: ^The effigy must be made. Straw, cloth, ribbon… and a mask. Only then will she accept the offering.
c-6: ^Silence is wise. Words can anger her.

g-1: ^Bring me the pieces. I will carve the face of the goddess.
^And together… we will drown death itself.
^Accept quest: I’ll find the items you need.
^Decline quest: I want nothing to do with this.

c-7: ^The old ways will thank you. Gather straw, cloth, ribbon… and the mask. When all is found, return to me.
c-8: ^Then winter will claim what it is owed. I will be here when you understand.

quest_declined_followup_dialogue: ^You return… yet without her gifts. Have you changed your mind?
^Accept quest: I’ll help you this time.

c-0: ^Good. Gather straw, cloth, ribbon, and the mask. Bring them to me when you are ready.
c-1: ^Then Her hunger will not wait forever. Go, while the frost still spares you.

quest_in_progress_dialogue: ^Have you found what I asked for?
^Then keep to the paths where the snow does not whisper. Bring the pieces soon… the air grows colder with each hour.
stage_002_dialogue: ^The player returns to Mara’s cabin. The mist outside is heavier than before. Inside, the air is freezing.
^You have them… I can feel their weight before you even step inside.
^Mara touches the straw, the fabric, the ribbon. Her hand lingers on the red ribbon, caressing it as if it were alive.
^Good… good… the threads of winter are weaving together again.
^The face. Without a face, she cannot see us. Without eyes, she cannot judge us.
^Mara picks up a sheep skull from the corner. Her hands tremble as she carves pagan symbols into it with a rusty knife, murmuring strange words.

c-0: ^Not for your ears. To speak her name too often is to invite frost into your lungs.
c-1: ^Madness is denying the cold when your bones already ache. Madness is pretending the dead do not hunger.
c-2: ^Wise again. The sheep bleat, but the shepherd knows when silence is safer.
g-0: ^It is done. The effigy breathes now.
^You must carry it to the altar, north of the village. Cast it into the frozen water, or the hunger of winter will never end.
^Then you will feed her with your flock… and your soul.

quest_completed_dialogue: ^The player carries the effigy through the storm to the frozen altar.
^The sheep panic. The dog refuses to approach. Mara appears near the altar.
^Throw it into the water… let her wake.
^Then the frost will claim you… one breath at a time.
^The player casts the effigy into the frozen waters.
^The ice cracks loudly. A heavy silence falls.
^Mara’s form begins to shift—her eyes glow pale, her skin turns to frost.

c-0: ^I am the end that walks with every step of man. I am the silence in the snow. I am death dressed in winter’s veil.
c-1: ^You walk on my breath, shepherd. Where would you run?
g-0: ^Every step toward survival is also a step toward death.
^From now on, shepherd… you belong to me.

s0: ^The frost has quieted since your offering.
s1: ^ She watches through your eyes now.
s3: ^ Winter is patient, shepherd. Always patient.
